Infact, with the exception of India, Nigeria, and Moroco every group of younger people have more faith than their older counterparts. I wonder if this disparity in faith is simply old people being pessimistic, or if it is a result of an overconfident younger generation that lack the wisdom to realistically look into the future. ace_sentences: The graph compares the faith of younger generations and older generations.
This faith is about future generations that will better the world.
I notice that younger people have a more positive outlook on the future of the world than older people.
I notice that younger people have more faith in the impact of new generations than older people.
In India, younger people do not have more faith than older people.
In Nigeria, younger people do not have more faith than older people.
In Morocco, younger people do not have more faith than older people.
In every other group, younger people have more faith than older people.
I wonder if this disparity in faith is caused by pessimism of old people.
I wonder if this disparity in faith is caused by overconfidence of younger people.
I think that an overconfident younger generation lacks wisdom.
I think that this lack of wisdom prevents younger people from looking realistically into the future.
This comparison does not relate to my community.
In my community, young people strive to better the world.
In my community, old people strive to better the world.
This striving happens regardless of the faith in future generations.
This comparison is only an insight into faith in the future.
